verses.meaning: I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is worshipped by Brahma, Vishnu and other devas, which shines with immaculate purity and brilliance, and which destroys the sorrows born of the cycle of birth and death.
I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is worshipped by the best of gods and sages, which burned the god of desire, which is the ocean of compassion, and which destroyed the pride of Ravana.
I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is anointed with all fragrant substances, which enhances intelligence and wisdom, and which is worshipped by siddhas, gods and demons alike.
I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is adorned with gold and great jewels, which is beautifully encircled by the king of serpents, and which destroyed the sacrifice of Daksha.
I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is anointed with saffron and sandalwood paste, which is beautifully adorned with lotus garlands, and which destroys accumulated sins.

verses.sanskrit:
देवगणार्चितसेवितलिङ्गं भावैर्भक्तिभिरेव च लिङ्गम्।
दिनकरकोटिप्रभाकरलिङ्गं तत्प्रणमामि सदाशिवलिङ्गम्॥
verses.transliteration:
devagaṇārcitasevita liṅgaṃ bhāvairbhaktibhireva ca liṅgam।
dinakarakoṭiprabhākaraliṅgaṃ tatpraṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam॥
verses.meaning: I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is worshipped and served by the hosts of gods with sincere devotion, and which shines with the brilliance of millions of suns.
I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is surrounded by eight petals, which is the cause of all creation, and which destroys the eight types of poverty.

verses.transliteration:
surugurursuravarpoojitaliṅgaṃ suravanapu ṣpasadārcitaliṅgam।
parātparaṃ paramātmakaliṅgaṃ tatpraṇamāmi sadāśivaliṅgam॥
verses.meaning: I bow before that eternal Shiva Lingam, which is worshipped by the guru of gods and the best of gods, which is always worshipped with celestial flowers, and which is the supreme transcendental self.

verses.sanskrit:
लिङ्गाष्टकमिदं पुण्यं यः पठेच्छिवसन्निधौ।
शिवलोकमवाप्नोति शिवेन सह मोदते॥
verses.transliteration:
liṅgāṣṭakamidaṃ puṇyaṃ yaḥ paṭhecchivasannidhau।
śivalokamavāpnoti śivena saha modate॥
verses.meaning: One who recites this sacred Lingashtakam in the presence of Lord Shiva attains the abode of Shiva and rejoices with Him eternally.
